summary: Adds a player house in Whiterun, in the location where Carlotta Valentia's home used to be.
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/UJ12AJk.png[/img][/center]
[center][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/65163/?][img]http://i.imgur.com/QtD7v94.png[/img][/url][/center]


As some of you may know, Breezehome in Whiterun can cause a crash to desktop with Hearthfire enabled. So, I decided to make a different house for my character that would be *in* Whiterun, instead of outside the walls; and, since I liked the final result, I figured I'd share. There don't seem to be many custom houses located in the town itself...

Now, Whiterun is not very big, so I had to tweak things around a bit. I liked the location of Carlotta Valentia's home (all my houses MUST have water nearby!), so I shamelessly took it for my own house and gave her a different one not too far away, upstream. I had to move the walls of the city and other things around a bit, just so you know - there may be compatibility issues there.

The house is really simple - it has alchemy and enchanting stations, cooking pot, one double bed, a bookcase, and plenty of safe storage. There is also a little indoor garden of sorts, and a garden outside with a bench to sit and enjoy the sun.

I tried to give kind of a theme to the place, including a note stuck to the door explaining the name of the house, and why it's empty, as well as feathers and the previous owner's journal. You can also find a house dog, named Idlar. Heh, get it? Because he idles, since he doesn't go anywhere? Yeah, I'll show myself out. In my defense, it's a Nord name from Tamriel Rebuilt's name generator. Finally, I placed a hidden chest under the bed for you to store your savings safely from thieves. Be sure to check it out!

No DLC required - just the main game. And yes, this means you cannot build a child's room here; the house is offered as-is. There's also a fast-travel marker, for your convenience.


[u][b]Finding the house:[/b][/u]
Sparrow Plains is in the Wind District, first house on the left after going up the steps to the left of the main gate. It cannot be missed!


[u][b]FIinding the key: [/b][/u]
The house is locked, and the key is somewhere in the vicinity. Good luck finding it! A small clue - look in the little yellow tree next to the grate upstream. One of the pictures I uploaded points at it.
[i][b]Spoiler:[/b] [url=http://i47.tinypic.com/ivhdtc.jpg]Here[/url] is a picture of the exact location, in case you still cannot find it.[/i]


[u][b]Notes[/b][/u]
I originally made this mod for the Steam Workshop. Link [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=111941508]here[/url]. To install, place the files in your 'SteamSteamAppsCommonSkyrimData' folder. Then activate the mod through your preferred launcher by ticking the checkbox next to the esp.


[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/UJ12AJk.png[/img][/center]
author: Jokerine
